website_summaries.verdict: A quality stainless steel pitcher that stands out for its sleek and stylish design.
pros: This gets top marks for its elegant look and design
Consumers report it not only looks beautiful and is well-made, but that it provides fresh-testing water as well
cons: Although the exterior design is stainless steel, the interior is lined with plastic, which some users were unsatisfied with
A few issues with the pitcher breaking

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel in this product is for decor, ...

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel pitcher seems like a great alternative to the standard
customer_reviews.text: The stainless steel pitcher seems like a great alternative to the standard, plastic Brita pitcher, especially if you want to reduce contaminants from plastic such as BPAs. That's why you take the trouble to filter water, right? The product description for the stainless steel model even says BPA free, to distinguish it further from the plastic model which carries no such claim. But what they don't tell you that in the description is that this pitcher is FULLY LINED with plastic. Yes, the stainless steel body is purely cosmetic. I'll leave it to the experts to determine whether it is actually BPA free or not. Pity that it wasn't steel as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: VWR

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS

But they are all right, the brita sits in a puddle in my fridge door and leaks all over the floor every time i pull it out. It looks nice, but save yourself the hassle and go to Target to buy a different one there. Also I know Los Angeles water is really bad, not even the brita filters it out, i still dont like the taste. I''ll probably start buying water from the store again and stock pile it.

customer_reviews.title: easily cracks/filter lights stop working

It filters just like my old Brita pitchers but the filter tracking lights were no longer functioning after three months, the black bottom cracked after four months and leaks if you overfill the pitcher. Tired of wiping up leaking water, I am replacing it the original Brita pitcher. The stainless steel look and features were not worth the extra cost.

customer_reviews.title: Contradicting
customer_reviews.text: This claims to be better than plastic pitchers due to plastic changing the property and flavor of water. I do prefer my beverages, especially water, to be contained in a glass or stainless steel container. This product is advertising that fact, yet the clear portion the pitcher that the water touches, as well as the filter holder the water runs through, are both made of plastic. Now tell me how that makes sense or is at all helpful? I am tempted to return this thing, but I have not seen one made from all glass or steel as of yet. Seriously Brita?! I thought you were better than that. I don't like "trickeration".
customer_reviews.author: Scorptress

product_meta.title: Brita Medium 8 Cup Water Filter Pitcher with 1 Standard Filter, BPA Free – Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Drink healthier, great tasting tap water with this BPA free Brita 8 cup water pitcher. With the Advanced filter technology, Brita cuts the taste and odor of chlorine to deliver great tasting water, and is certified to reduce copper, cadmium and mercury impurities, which can adversely affect your health over time. This Brita water pitcher is made with fingerprint resistant stainless steel and has a comfort grip handle which makes pouring easy. The flip top lid makes refilling a breeze and just a glance at the electronic filter indicator lets you know when it is time to change the Brita replacement filter. This medium water pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results.

Reduce waste & save: one Brita water filter can replace 300 standard 16 ounce Water bottles which saves you money and reduces plastic waste
